intro: Phyllanthus almadensis, commonly known as the Almaden phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological requirements.
